website_summaries.verdict: A top brand, reliable performance, and user-friendly features put this steam iron at the top of the pack.
pros: DripStop function results in less water leakage than many others in its class
Heats fast and produces decent steam
Sleek soleplate moves smoothly over most materials
cons: Some plastic components don't feel very durable

website_summaries.verdict: Combines an impressive 3100 watts of power with a nice price that earn it our top spot in performance and value.
pros: Very powerful and glides almost effortlessly over materials
cons: Occasionally leaks and leaves behind stains

customer_reviews.title: I am Iron man!
customer_reviews.text: I'll be honest... I bought this because it looks like the sort of thing Darth Vader would use to iron his cloak! Unlike Darth Vader I cant use the force, so it's a good thing for me that this iron is easy to use, smooth and not too heavy. Lots of steam and makes short work of this boring job!
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Used iron recieved
customer_reviews.text: Recived a used dirty iron with water inside and limescale outside, see the pictures. It was nicely packaged as new, very cheeky. Returning now.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. I. Watson

customer_reviews.title: It’s has a notch - just like the iPhone X !!
customer_reviews.text: Great iron. Heats up quickly, generates plenty of steam and has a very smooth plate so glides over the clothes easily. The only downside (hence 4 instead of 5nsyars) is that the heat indicators aren’t very clear - so it’s tricky to work out where the cotton or wool settings are. The best thing though is - it has a notch ! Just like the iPhone X ! The notch enables you to iron round buttons - which is oddly satisfying !
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Extremely powerful, great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I wanted a powerful iron to get rid off the diff creases (tumble dried clothes). This did an amazing job, wth it’s extremely powerful steam. I wanted to buy a big steam iron but could not because of space issue so settled for buying this. That turned out to be a great decision as this one did a pretty good job. I bough mine last year and after that have bought 2 more of the same - one for parents and another one for in laws. It has not given us any issue. Would recommend this product to everyone who wants a powerful heavy iron
customer_reviews.author: Sid

customer_reviews.title: ... the cable exactly same iron as i had before best iron i have ever had and i have had ...
customer_reviews.text: bought this iron as a replacement for my old one that cat chewed the cable exactly same iron as i had before best iron i have ever had and i have had alot of irons
customer_reviews.author: tub

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant. Husband and son love the space age look ...
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant. Husband and son love the space age look and now enjoy ironing. Heats quickly. no leaking at low temperatures. perfectly satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: K.A.Y.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: As I was ironing, it has created yellow rusty marks on my partners shirt that will not come out. I haven’t even had the iron 6 months yet.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Best iron I've ever owned. just drinksss water if you keep using the power steam button.
customer_reviews.text: Best iron I've ever owned. just drinksss water if you keep using the power steam button. Very good iron for the price. it was this of the Philips azure but this was cheaper and cant complain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Came with water inside.
customer_reviews.text: The iron is a great iron per se, I am not sure I got a product refurbished as it came with water inside and smells very funny. Maybe someone didn't like the product and has returned it and they have sent it to me, a returned item. I don't like to give bad reviews. But this iron is noisy, smells like burnt plastic and came with water inside. I have never bought an iron that came with water inside. It is strange. Always had Russel Hobbs appliances and never had problems. But I am not happy with my purchase. Not sure it is going to last. I am unhappy about this.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Buselli

customer_reviews.title: Carry On Looking...
customer_reviews.text: Received product and it stunk as there was water remnants in the reservior. There's a sticker in the box saying that water droplets are due to quality control testing... Bit of a laugh seeing as the steam didn't even work (and the limescale around the plating was a little suspect too) yet there's no mention of droplets and quality testing in instruction manual, which you would expect if it was legit. Can't help but feel that the company is repackaging returned irons and slapping on this 'quality control' sticker as a work around. Been offered a replacement. Will see what that's like but my advice... Carry on looking.
customer_reviews.author: VSin

customer_reviews.title: Waiting to see if it keeps working
customer_reviews.text: Reading the reviews there are an alarming number which say this product is very unreliable. If you've ever bought a Russell Hobbs kettle you'll agree. I'm giving this one star because I'll wait for a few months and if it's still working (!) will update accordingly. First impressions are: flimsy controls, small ironing plate, much heavier than my old one. Worked the first time I used it so here's hoping .....
customer_reviews.author: NorthamptontownFC

customer_reviews.title: Leaky and Lacking in Steam...
customer_reviews.text: Found it a bit odd that this was supposed to be a brand new item, and arrived with dirty fetid water inside and some limescale build-up on the outside. Tested it regardless and it's dreadful. Leaked constantly from the water-filling port down the handle and into the cord. Added to which, on the highest steam setting, it just about managed to generate a little bit of steam. Very poorly built unreliable piece of kit, like numerous other Russell Hobbs electrical products.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weird shaped iron, bulky
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron because my friend recommended it. Not sure how I feel about it yet to be honest. It has two chunks out of it, that are good for around buttons but when I've been ironing it's catching the clothes and making new creases in. Maybe it's the way I'm using it... it feels quite bulky compared to my last iron and I don't feel like it's very smooth over the clothes. I'll keep using it, hopefully I'll just get used to it
customer_reviews.author: MrsW84

customer_reviews.title: Yikes - I shouldn't have bought this !!!
customer_reviews.text: Just used this for the first time. Bought very quickly and didn't bother to read the reviews. Probably the worst iron I have used in 40 years. VERY heavy. The steam button when pressed issues an irritating squeak every time, the sole plate doesn't glide as well as previous irons e.g. Murphy Richards. I will keep this to use as an emergency iron but will be buying another iron today !!!!!!! Being a Carer I use an iron every day and this one just makes ironing an unpleasant experience. The only good thing I can say about it is that it does have a long power cord.
customer_reviews.author: RAC

customer_reviews.title: best iron i have owned
customer_reviews.text: this is a great iron & really performs wel. no crease is to much for this little beauty.
customer_reviews.author: rumoclock

customer_reviews.title: However it just seemed to blow up there was a horrible burning smell plus it marked my new ironing board ...
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with this iron. However it just seemed to blow up there was a horrible burning smell plus it marked my new ironing board cover it only lasted for a few month terrible. To be honest I wouldn't even gibe it 1 star! Don't buy!
customer_reviews.author: Alison C.

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend. Essentially won't turn on
customer_reviews.text: This iron lasted 16 months of light use, basically 5 shirts a week. My last iron went for over 5 years. I would not recommend. Essentially won't turn on. It has done this before but has come back to life on other times. I also usually had to replace the plug as the one it came with split in half and screwing it back together wouldn't work. I won't but Russell Hobbs again and will be asking for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: We're on the second one in 6 months and yet again it's failing to produce any steam- will be asking for a refund
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing...
customer_reviews.text: After my Philips azur Pro died after years of loyal service, I chose this as a replacement based on the great reviews. Since I’d had my old one for 8yrs I was expecting a huge improvement in technology And performance but unfortunately this didn’t impress. I liked the cord length and weight, however the iron just didn’t perform all that great. Even at full heat it didn’t remove creases, with the steam on it left sheets damp and more wrinkled than they had started. I tried it on jeans, t shirts and sheets before I just gave up and returned for another Philips azur which is far superior luckily as I had to redo all of the RH clothes.
customer_reviews.author: CherR

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron as it had good reviews. I am disappointed for a number of reasons: 1) As you iron your hand nudges the temperature gage which means you have to keep manually adjusting it back to where it was 2) It is light weight which actually means it doesn’t feel as though it is heavy enough to iron well. I also dropped the ironing whilst ironing which cracked the plastic chunks fell off the black plastic surround. Never had that issue with previous irons. Lights weight = poor quality 3) There is no cord wrap. So when not in use nothing on the iron that you can wrap the cord around
customer_reviews.author: Becks

customer_reviews.title: New, or Secondhand?
customer_reviews.text: This is a review on how the item arrived and not based on useage, at this time. On removing the iron from its packaging, we discovered everything was wet. We thought it might be condensation, but on closer inspection now believe that the iron isn’t a new item, but a return. There are marks on the plastic and it doesn’t look like a new item (as believed on purchasing), at all. I’m not sure where that leaves us, from a consumer perspective? Have I bought a ‘second’ on the belief that I had bought a brand new item?
customer_reviews.author: Andy webb

customer_reviews.title: Beats Philips Azur at less than half the price
customer_reviews.text: It's a big solid iron and matches the quality of the Philips Azur irons which I have had before at more than twice the price. The latest Azur packed in after 2yrs of weekly use and so I thought it time for a new brand due to their gradual decline in quality leading to their price being unjustifiable. I'm so glad I tried this as it's quality. Quite heavy and solid feeling which reduces the amount of pressure required which makes it easier to use and the cable is nice and long. I'm really happy with this and if you're used to Azur irons but have been disappointed lately, this is the way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: A first class iron
customer_reviews.text: According to Yulia this is a great iron and so much so she ordered one for herself - she says it works really well and is the best she has used for a while - even better was the price - all in all a great buy
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Pressing Issue
customer_reviews.text: The Darth Vader review caught my eye and this iron does resemble a 'Star Destroyer' I guess. This iron works very well, it is heavy but that can help as you don't need to put as much pressure on yourself but of you like your irons light, this isn't for you. The cable is insanely long, ideal for plugging in and having no restrictions from an overly short one but there is nowhere to store it when not in use. The most annoying thing, for me anyway, is that your hand constantly catches the heat control dial under the handle as there isn't much room. If you have big mitts you may struggle.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Bobster

customer_reviews.title: Not the normal Russel Hobbs quality
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy iron with a large handle. Would not suit anyone with small hands. Steam supply seems temperamental. Also has a nasty habit of tripping the electrics when I use steam boost
customer_reviews.author: Treacle miner

customer_reviews.title: Leaky, no Steam, kept turning off, water everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron just over 1 month ago which makes it hard to return now. I've used it twice in the last two days and on both occasions it extended the time taken to perform the simple task of ironing and in the process, covered the ironing board and carpet with water. Stay away from this poor quality product, it's heavy, it leaks water, it has "intelligence" to auto switch off when idle which cuts in all the time when in use - not helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Gawain

customer_reviews.title: Cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: Big, heavy, and cumbersome. If you want an iron to steam curtains then this may be for you. For ironing clothes I find it very unsuitable. Extremely arkward because of its size and weight. Also a very long power lead (I suspect you would still need an extension lead if steaming hanging curtains so no advantage) which keeps getting in the way and is positively dangerous because invariably ends up at you feet risking a trip. I had to curl it up and secure with a cable tie - not recommended for power leads but the safer option in this case. A bad purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KmG

customer_reviews.title: The Good and the Bad
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in the hope it was better than the one I had. Just had to send it back after three days. The timing on the safety cut out was off by almost double. Once the Iron turns its self on to sleep mode in the upright position on two occasions it just didn’t steam. A total pain in the butt to be honest. Sadly caused me more inconvenience than helped. I’m sure there’s good units out there, bet beware, these are cheap mass produced units and it shows. The foot plate is super thin. The good is the weight, it’s heavy enough to take some of the need to press out of the ironing. You takes ya chances
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Nice iron
customer_reviews.text: A lot heavier than I realised but now I've used it for a while am very happy with it. Nice narrow sole plate for fiddly bits. Long cable that's a bit tricky to wind and anchor round iron.
customer_reviews.author: Janice H Regan

customer_reviews.title: Decent performance, but doesn't last as long as expected
customer_reviews.text: Having previously owned this iron for over two years, it performs well especially with the tapered tip and button groove; it feels light enough to move around easily, heats up to full temperature quickly and the steam/spray features work well without draining the large water tank, producing a professionally ironed finish. However, only using the iron once or twice a week, a build-up of limescale soon became a regular issue which, despite cleaning using both the self-cleaning function and a professional solution, in the end couldn't be resolved and the iron has had to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: TKO464

customer_reviews.title: Steam output erratic and a heavy iron
customer_reviews.text: Terrible iron, the steam stopped after a year and didn't get hot enough to iron cotton, complained to Amazon who sent me a replacement and that had the same problem straight away, heavy iron too. Made ironing hard work, gave up complaining and bought myself a Murphy Richards one instead, and so far it's a 100 per cent improvement on the Russell Hobbs one. Can't believe overall it has such a high ratings
customer_reviews.author: suegarm

customer_reviews.title: Another Disappointing Steam Iron.
customer_reviews.text: I am always dissappointed with steam irons. This is no exception. After the first water refill it invariably drips big blobs on the ironing which often cause marks after the hot iron dries them (and yes, I do wait till the iron has fully heated). Even worse these blobs are often rusty and leave nasty rust stains (and yes, I do regularly clean and descale, and empty water chamber after use)
customer_reviews.author: Redhouse

customer_reviews.title: worked well for 1 year
customer_reviews.text: worked well for 1 year, used about once a week for 10-15 mins so total life time about 13 hours of use. when it worked it was great, didn't cause any stains did a good job but after 1 year to the very day it stopped producing steam and when i hold the iron horizontal it leaks any water which is in the reservoir onto the clothes. considered buying another for £30 which isn't too bad for 1 year but for £59 i'm rather hopeful the philips one will last much more than 13 hours and be a better long term saving.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: A little but disappointed with this. The temperature dial has very little in the way of indicator points on it. If you have large hands, you will find that your knuckles move the temp dial whilst ironing. Very annoying. The steam function is not good. Most annoying is that there is no way to store the cord when not ironing. So you have to wind it round the bottom and then hold it to stop it slipping off the bottom when putting it away. Had I looked at the product a bit more thoroughly before I bought it, i probably would have noticed this obvious design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Only for thought it would have been five without the aforementioned
customer_reviews.text: I like this iron although it is a little heavy to use as I suffer with arthritis. The only problem I have with it is that when you are ironing your fingers are knuckles tend to flick the temperature dial under the handle needs a slightly larger space also filling the iron with water is difficult if you are right-handed because it opens to the right you have to try and fill it with your left hand take note Russell Hobbs and either designed it so it will it backwards towards the handle so it can be filled easily by either right or left handed people Hence the four stars it would have been five
customer_reviews.author: Cmc

customer_reviews.title: I paid for a new one but did I get refurbished ?
customer_reviews.text: I have received this iron today. The steam ironing function is not working and the iron is not heating well (This is not my first time using an iron and I followed all the steps in the manual). I contacted Customer support and they told me to descale the iron and when I ask them "Why should I descale if the iron is brand new?" I didn't get any proper answer from both customer support members. I am returning this product back. I will buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ozy

customer_reviews.title: Lasted less than 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Bought our iron January 2019, broke September 2020 and now gone to the local council tip. The iron itself is just an iron but annoyed lasted less than two years before breaking despite only ever using ionised water to generate the steam. It failed by tripping the electric circuit in the house, and when the electric was reset it tripped again until the iron was unplugged. Tested another socket downstairs and the same happened again so definitely the iron. No idea what the problem was but am not having a dangerous electric product in the house. Thankfully our house has a modern RCD circuit protector, as wouldn’t trust using the product without one; too dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Sidmouth

customer_reviews.title: Russell Hobbs Powersteam Ultra 3100 W Vertical Steam Iron 20630
customer_reviews.text: Found this iron to be a very poor design. although the cord is long there is no way of securely wrapping it around the iron making it difficult to store. The temperature dial is not positive in it's setting and therefor very easy to accidentally alter whilst ironing. Although there are indicators on the dial denoting high to low temperatures there is no indicator on the surround of the dial suggesting where the setting should be. It seems to struggle with simple creases and I get the impression that it does not emit enough steam whilst ironing. I'm single so do not have piles of ironing but if I did.........
customer_reviews.author: Mr. J.C.

customer_reviews.title: Great iron let down by one annoying detail
customer_reviews.text: Having served for ten years in the army I know my irons and this one is great bar one major design floor - the is no recess or notch on its base to hold the wrapped cord in place. This may sound like a minor detail but it is incredibly frustrating when stowing it away.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: We love our new friend!
customer_reviews.text: I always do my research before I buy anything. So it took me some time to choose between more expensive options and Russell Hobbs Powersteam Steam Iron. I am happy with my choice! It's amazing! I do not iron everyday, but once a week I do my husbands shirts and this iron makes my job so much more pleasurable. Especially this feature for ironing in between of buttons – great idea! Why other irons don't have it?! With this purchase I feel like I've won a jackpot: great price, great iron!
customer_reviews.author: Oksana Novozilova

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: Really love this iron & it's pretty tough. It's fell quite a few times from the top of the wardrobe which has slightly bent the tip but it's still working spot on. Heats up super quick, powers through creases & has a wide water pouring hole. My downsides for this iron would be that the temperature gauge is easily moved when picking it up, it's rather heavy when full of water & if your using it at max temperature it's really thirsty & requires water more often. That being said I'm more than happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: Great iron but quite heavy
customer_reviews.text: A great iron this. Does all the things you would expect. Irons. Heats up. Cools down. Couple of minor annoyances. 1) it’s pretty heavy, so might want to be avoided by anyone with carpel tunnel or with an aversion to lifting heavy burning hot objects. 2) the cord doesn’t have a straight forward wrap around so you need to think carefully about how you store it. However, I love it. I actually hate ironing with a passion, but this does make light work of things. Though ironically by being heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Xussia

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I had a steam generator iron before and got fed up of lugging it about, too cumbersome, so when it broke I went for this and haven't looked back!! It presses just as well, is super easy to fill, holds a good amount of water and the safety features are amazing (the beep to tell you it's been left on is so good!!) Really impressed, makes ironing a doddle
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Steam
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item in October 2018 and the steam button has stuck already and is hard to iron without the steam
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Iron
customer_reviews.text: I bought this only because our friend did the research and it was on sale. I returned the first one because there was water in the iron and when it happened on the second delivery (like it had been used), I read the reviews and they had said the manufacturers test it so sometimes water might be present. Anyway I used it and all is fine. Its bigger than my previous iron but feels very sturdy and I like that it switches off when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great quality at a bargain price
customer_reviews.text: Can I say I'm astonished, never expected such a Good quality iron from Russel Hobbs. This item is far better then most of the top brands I've purchased within the last 2 years. I've purchased two top brand irons and both have gone bust. Within a month they were leaking water and became faulty. But this iron was a fraction of the cost and has out performed my expectations thus far. This is a good quality iron at bargain price
customer_reviews.author: Blacksweetnes

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, Happy with the buy.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect, generates plenty of steam water tank is big enough to hold water so that you can use iron on full steam settings and has a very smooth plate so glides over the clothes easily without burning and changing their colours. The only reason I m giving it 4 stars is that the heat indicators is not very clear - so it’s tricky to work out where the cotton or wool settings are and the cord is bit small to reach my iron stand. Otherwise its a strong and reliable iron.
customer_reviews.author: umar farooq

customer_reviews.title: Good safety features.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a quick replacement as my iron stopped working. The Russell Hobbs iron was delivered the next day. It is a little heavier than my previous iron, also I’ve noticed it’s very thirsty. The lead is extra long, which is useful for moving about and it cuts out if left switched on and not used for a time. I think it gives out a warning bleep if it’s left on and not being used. I’m pleased with the ironing results having used this for a few weeks now.
customer_reviews.author: annienannie

customer_reviews.title: Nice item
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice item, I like Russell Hobbs irons as they are more compact than many other brands and this makes them easier to use. Actually I never used this item as it was purchased as a gift which ended up being duplicated so I returned it. Thank you Amazon. I have however happily owned one of these myself for some years............ which of course is why I chose it as a gift, can't recommend it higher than that!
customer_reviews.author: CommonMan

customer_reviews.title: Erm. Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: Erm. I have one iron that i've had for years and bought this to replace it. I prefer my old one. The new one has hardly any punch to get rid of creases. It's an iron. That's its job and it can't do it. If i'm doing something wrong it would be great to know. Its an iron.
customer_reviews.author: JennyFromTheBlock

customer_reviews.title: Weight and water capacity let it down a tiny bit.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the wife to replace our broken one and I have to say we are both impressed. Temp is great, cord length is good and overall the look of the iron is great. My only negative comments which resulted in its 4 star review would be the weight, its a bit heavier than similar sized models. Secondly the water tank capacity is not brilliant compared again to similar sized and priced models. On the whole love it very pleased
customer_reviews.author: Michael Suter

customer_reviews.title: Hefty & uncomfortable to use.
customer_reviews.text: I hate this but husband likes it! The handle is far too wide - I have large hands for a woman but it's too wide to be comfortable for me. Luckily, husband does most of the ironing in our house (work shirts, school uniform, etc) & he thinks it's fine. No heat guard for when it's cooling down/storage, either. Quite heavy/hefty. Don't think it will be long before I replace this - typical husband, buying by price over quality!!
customer_reviews.author: Yjess

customer_reviews.title: Good iron and great value
customer_reviews.text: Really good iron and great value. I brought this based on the positive reviews from customers and have to say I am not disappointed; the iron isn’t heavy, the hot plate glides well, the water tank is big so don’t have to top up every few minutes, the cord is a decent length so not fighting it and I like the indents so you can get in and around buttons easily. Good iron and great value.
customer_reviews.author: 9193benjaminb

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this iron a year ago. I should have returned it when I initially purchased it, as it took 5 minutes to heat up . Now it has completely stopped working, not heating up at all. I have descaled it several times and ensure I use filtered water in the iron to prevent build-up of limescale. It does spit out brown water, staining shirts. I have called Russell Hobbs but they say it would take up to 4 weeks to resolve the issue, that is too long without an iron.
customer_reviews.author: Maddie

customer_reviews.title: Tried once and returning
customer_reviews.text: There’s a reason these are so cheap ... like many mine to had water droplets I iron for a living and can’t recall ever seeing this before on a new product ... the steam is rubbish if your doing linen straight from the go it’s leaving water spray spots ... the temperature control is hit and miss to ... bought this thinking Russell Hobbs was a trusted name for irons ... I’ll stick to the Bosch .
customer_reviews.author: deano

customer_reviews.title: heavy and porr overall
customer_reviews.text: Got this iron few months back and regretted not sending it back it shortly after. The iron is heavy, creates more creases than removes and has a poor efficiency when it comes to both steam or steam burst. avoid at all cost :(
customer_reviews.author: Aleksandra Kazmierczak

customer_reviews.title: Great Iron!
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and easily glides over all fabrics. Really good quality build with a decent cable length. Only grip is that there is no auto iron function whereby I can press a button or synch to my phone so it does all my ironing for me... oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Galeforce1701

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful high-spec iron but you'd need Schwarzenegger to lift it!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved the spec of this iron - safe, efficient, everything I wanted - but I almost sprained my thumb just getting it out of the box. There's no way I could iron wish it filled with water. It's beautiful, and looks like it will do a great job, but not if you're a small OAP without massive muscles.
customer_reviews.author: H. McCarthy

customer_reviews.title: Ceramic plate is good!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered based on previous good reviews. So far we have been using this iron for a few weeks and it has not disappointed. It gets hot very quickly, is easy to fill and has a long cord. There is a decent weight to the iron and the ceramic plate seems to make the job easier. It does get through a lot of water, but it's worthwhile having the extra steam!
customer_reviews.author: lasty12

customer_reviews.title: Yesterday this iron failed.
customer_reviews.text: There seems to be an intermitant fault on this iron. after 90 odd min use it shut down, I changed and tested the fuse all ok, this morning it worked when pluged in, we require to test it (use it) to confirm a fault or not. This item may well require a full refund or replacement. Ordered in April 2018.
customer_reviews.author: Eric C. Thelen

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 5 months- be wary!
customer_reviews.text: This iron was fine for the first 5 months and it has a nice long 3m cord but it has suddenly stopped working, light is flashing but it does not heat up. Manufacturer says to return to seller as it is under 6 months old. However, I cannot see how to return it as the original return window of 30 days has closed. Frustrating!
customer_reviews.author: HJD14

customer_reviews.title: BRILLIANT IRON AND BUY
customer_reviews.text: BOUGHT THIS IRON ON SPEC AND EXTREMELY PLEASED WITH ITS PERFORMANCE AND THE HITHER TOO SAFETY FEATURE I WASN'T AWARE THAT IT TURNS OFF IF NOT USED FOR 5 MINS, SO NO PROBLEMS IF YOUR RUSHING TO WORK AND IRON SOMETHING LAST MINUTE AND RUSH OUT THE DOOR BECAUSE YOU MAY BE LATE APART FROM THIS ITS GREAT LOOKING TO BOOT SO I'M VERY PLEASED WITH THE IRON OVERALL ETC
customer_reviews.author: Michael Williams

customer_reviews.title: Arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this iron in August, it arrived and remained unpacked until 2 weeks ago due to moving house. Box was undamaged, had been stored correctly but unfortunately when opening the iron the black plastic had been broken on both sides. It was packaged inside with cardboard so very difficult to see how it could have happened. The iron is still usable but unfortunately doesn't look too sightly. Overall the iron is good, holds a good quantity of water, glides well, good steam. The temperature gauge is at the bottom and difficult to see but OK once you know where it is.
customer_reviews.author: Charl

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: My old steam iron had given up the ghost after about 14 years, I bought a steam generator iron, but it is just too much hassle, (storage and hauling about and waiting) to iron 1/2 a dozen shirts. This is so much more convenient and faster! It is not lightweight, but that makes for a quicker ironing job anyway. Nice and smooth and the button notch is a nice detail
customer_reviews.author: margaret leece

customer_reviews.title: Great iron
customer_reviews.text: A light iron that is very good at getting creases out even at a lower temperature. Easy to handle and simple to understand instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs P

customer_reviews.title: Decent Iron - does what it needs to
customer_reviews.text: Decent Iron - heats up well, has good steam and does a decent job on clothes. The cord is really long and not really an inconvenience (prefer a longer cord actually). Only gripe is that the pressure steam shot is very powerful and a bit too much steam comes out to control. Not a big issue at all - long may this Iron last as it was a bit pricey for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Mr G

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with product
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t write a review for a while and glad I waited. Less than a year old. The steam facility stopped working at some point and dry iron doesn’t work on many tops or any bedding now so obviously isn’t hot enough. I’ve been talking to Amazon chat, 4 different people who ended chat if I didn’t reply for 2 minutes (but I had to wait for them). I was told Amazon would help with this. It’s only 7 months old!
customer_reviews.author: Becky Baldry

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 18 months....then expired.
customer_reviews.text: Initially worked well. Strong steam setting and good weight. At 18 months, started smoking and went “Phut”. Disappointed, as previous iron had lasted 15 years. Looking over the other reviews, this seems to be an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Lamond

customer_reviews.title: Not egonomical
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it's the weight or the way the grip is designed but this iron is not comfortable to use. I did see other reviewer suggesting this, but thought that was nonsense...how bad can an iron be? Turns out it can be bad....
customer_reviews.author: Kam

customer_reviews.title: Had two of these both failed after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Purchase one of these after a while the steam stopped working. Amazon replaced like for like, three months on steam and temperature control not working on replacement. Iron was cleaned according to instructions (built on steam clean) so something clearly amiss with these irons. Returning for refund and buying one from another manufacturer - not trusting to ‘third time lucky!’
customer_reviews.author: Wiltscat

customer_reviews.title: Horrible iron
customer_reviews.text: I would not recommend this iron, it's heavy also it does not glide across the fabric your ironing. Also there is not enough room between the handle and the temperature control, which causes you to keep knocking it as your ironing. The plate is to thin which causes it to catch on the fabric as your moving it backwards. Overall I hate using this iron.
customer_reviews.author: christine davin

customer_reviews.title: Good iron, does the job
customer_reviews.text: Happy with the iron. The only thing is that when I opened the box and looked at the iron there were beads of water inside, so seems this iron had been used and returned? Not good really as this was bought as news. Seems to work okay but a bit worried that someone had returned it for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy iron!
customer_reviews.text: This iron is extremely heavy; therefore there are plus & minus's. On the plus side, you don't need to exert much pressure to iron, but on the minus side, it's very heavy to lift. I've now got used to it and don't mind, but when I first used it, I was tempted to send it back as in comparison to my old one (a supermarket brand) it felt ridiculously weighty.
customer_reviews.author: JAW

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very good for the price, very heavy but I like that about it. The filling aperture when opened for filling is large which makes it easy and quick. Decent steam and spray. Had this months now. It's still going strong very easy to use and glides across clothes lovely.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: A really powerful, lightweight iron.
customer_reviews.text: A really powerful, lightweight iron. The cost of this product, for the quality is amazing, it really does well what an iron should do. It is easy to use, quite light and not chunky, and really does pack a punch with easy to control temperatures and a very simple fill system. For the price, this is one of the best irons we have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This iron is very cumbersome ...not a sleek design...and doesn't steam very well. The cable length is the best feature and it beeps after a certain time when not in use which is also good. However, the constant steam isn't great and the button for the shot of steam is on the right side of the two buttons on the top of the iron (the other for a squirt of water) which is the opposite side to every other iron I have ever used and I find this very uncomfortable when ironing. This, together with the the poor steam output are the reasons I wouldnt recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne

customer_reviews.title: Annoying notch in the soleplate
customer_reviews.text: I like that is lightweight and it irons well. The steam works well but water needs to be refilled quite quickly. I don't like the notch in the soleplate, it catches on cuffs and things but I use it to wrap the cord around the iron for storage, there doesn't seem any other reason for it and no other way to wrap the cord around the iron and there is no clip to hold the plug in place when stored so I had to take the one from my old iron. It looks nice though... Lol
customer_reviews.author: Ka

customer_reviews.title: doesnt glide well
customer_reviews.text: not a fan. I replaced my big steam Iron with this small iron and regretting it instantly. I thought going from a big bulky iron and board to a small one it would be easier to use. but the steam function has to be pressed at all times if you want the iron to glide over the clothes and takes a lot more effort. I will be saving up for a decent steam iron and binning this in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: cubby

customer_reviews.title: Really heavy
customer_reviews.text: Use for the first time today. Puts out a good amount of steam and heat which is great for dry creased items. I found the temperature dial unclear and difficult to know if it was turned to the right temperature but the biggest disappointment was the weight of the iron....it is really heavy!! I only ironed a few items and found it hard work.
customer_reviews.author: maz

customer_reviews.title: Sprays brown water after 2 months low usage
customer_reviews.text: Never had an iron that spits brown water, only used for 2 months and brown water all over white shirt. Been ironing for 38 years had white limescale occasionally but never this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent plate. Good smooth iron with nice long cord.
customer_reviews.text: Great iron this. Probably the best one i have used. It is large. The plate is nice and smooth and it has good temperature regulation. It doesn't get too hot like my old morphy richards iron would and melt my work shirts. I never use water in my steam iron so i cant tell you about the steam production etc. But it works so good with a few squirts of a water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Rouse

customer_reviews.title: Best iron I've used
customer_reviews.text: I like this iron. Used it a few times now. Powerful with good steam blast. People have commented on weight, but it's an iron! It's not heavy to use at all. Good water storage but you go through it if you use the blast as often as I did (linens). Good for steam blasting stuff on hangers because of blast
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hall

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Short ironing plate with gaps either side of the point that get caught in the buttons of my shirts. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not the best iron in the world
customer_reviews.text: The wire sits at the top end of the iron which catches on my arm so I don't find this particularly comfortable, however, the water tank feed is on the left of the iron which is great for me as a left handed person. I can't say this is the best iron I've ever used but it wasn't expensive so I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Laddie

customer_reviews.title: Shocking
customer_reviews.text: Item came ....looked used ......and as soon as I pluged it in it blew my electrics ...to then I noticed the plug was broken in bits ....do not buy
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: No place to keep cord
customer_reviews.text: So the actual ironing function is average however 3 stars as I never thought not having a place to wrap the cord around would be such an inconvenience. I have soon figured out that it is a terrible design issue and potentially a safety one as there is no secure place to wrap the cord and it may catch on the iron plate.
customer_reviews.author: Vijay

customer_reviews.title: Great iron all round. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I love this iron. Weighty, powerful... really does the job. There is nook either side of the tip which - in theory - makes it easier to get around buttons (at least that’s why I think it’s there). Sounds strange to say but it took me a few shirts to get used to that! Would thoroughly recommend though. Excellent quality and - for the price - excellent value. Also... the water tank is super easy to fill as the hole is large. Would recommend for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Love this IRON simply  Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Best iron I've purchased Love this iron Makes the pile a doddle and quite enjoyable Very quite to iron tumble dried shirts Quite heavy but I like this about the iron Just noticed it has an emergency switch off system for when you havent used it for 10 mins or more A++++ FOR THIS PURCHASE
customer_reviews.author: Rochelle

customer_reviews.title: Obviously a great value iron to use as well as gaupe at.
customer_reviews.text: Five stars accross the board and I've only taken it out of the box to look at it. Seriously what more could you want for thirty quid ? Its from a company who know what they're doing and so you are never going to be completely disappointed. Luckily I have not ironed for over five years now, preferring to buy new instead - especially when the situation gets desperate. Hopefully it will leave everything looking and feeling a little flat . If it doesn't I will forgive it anyway and build it a nice display case.
customer_reviews.author: John D.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Rough around the edges causing it to catch on clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. BM Thakur

customer_reviews.title: need to let you know, we have had this ...
customer_reviews.text: need to let you know, we have had this for a year and four months which I don't regard as a long time for an iron, and this evening it started to make fizzing noises along with a burning smell. I daren't plug it in again so the iron is now unusable which is disappointing after such a short period.
customer_reviews.author: S. A. Haines

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Great iron. Nice and heavy which means it’s easier! I iron for 10 people so gets used daily! Cord is longer than normal which is great as I don’t need an extension cable. Safety features made me jump as I didn’t read the book first! Scared the living daylights out of me when it beeped because I’d left it on!
customer_reviews.author: Pam Allen

customer_reviews.title: Steam iron
customer_reviews.text: It isn't the best but working fine. Requires me to be more reliant on the steam feature to get creases out than I would have otherwise liked to... When it arrived, I could notice condensation on the inner water compartment which made me think that the product I received from Amazon had possibly been used before and repackaged...but was too busy to report that earlier and needed to iron clothes immediately so kept it anyway
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Russell Hobbs iron
customer_reviews.text: Not up to Russell Hobbs usual high standard. Extremely heavy to use. Instructions not as clear as they could be. Took a good 4 times to get used to using it. Actually I am quite disappointed all in all and hope it does not last as long as my previous iron. Also almost impossible to register online and I had to send a separate email with the request that they do it for me. Sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Trust the reviews it’s a decent iron for a reasonable price :-)
customer_reviews.text: really impressed with the time this iron saves me compared to my old one. I didn’t want to pay silly money for a steam iron with a separate steam tank so went with the good reviews and so far so good! It irons well even without the steam function on. I also find that it doesn’t have the usual issue of welding itself at high temperatures. It’s runs really smoothly over all different kinds of fabric.
customer_reviews.author: JAK1976

customer_reviews.title: Takes a bit of getting used to...
customer_reviews.text: Generally good, nice looking iron if a little on the heavy side. Great cord length but could do with a means to easily wind/retain securely when not in use. Odd that when the water filler container is "full" it is only a bit over half full as far as the water tank on the iron itself is concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Moonraker

customer_reviews.title: Great Iron
customer_reviews.text: The temp dial does get knocked and settings get changed accidentally. The auto off feature is great and has been tested twice already ;-) . Not really lightweight with a full tank. I like it though - if Bruce Wayne had to do his ironing, this is the one that would be in the bat cave. I like it a lot :-)
customer_reviews.author: S. G. Pathakji

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy steam iron
customer_reviews.text: No one likes ironing but this is what to choose when you have to have one to do it! It is fairly heavy so more effective to use and gives a very satisfactory finish. The steam feature is quite strong and does not drop random spots of water on the ironing board. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy, but irons really well
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with a scratch on the surface. It looks pretty simple iron and quite heavy. I would say just an ordinary iron... it reminds me to the old fashion irons... if I have seen it in real on store display, I would never buy it. However after I tried iron it really do a good job easy pissy and provides good quality of iron service.
customer_reviews.author: MISS TA PILITIS

customer_reviews.title: Nice Iron, but only lasted 18 months!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good iron in terms of features and sturdiness, but only lasted 18months. Very frustrating as these consumer items don't seem built to last, and only come with 12 months warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Havens

product_meta.title: Russell Hobbs Powersteam Ultra 3100 W Vertical Steam Iron 20630 - Black and Grey
product_meta.description: The Russell Hobbs 20630 Power Steam Ultra Iron is a welcome addition to anyone who finds ironing a chore. Detailing a Ceramic Soleplate with button grooves means the 20630 delivers a great result with little effort. With features such as triple action cleaning, improved glide and a 15% faster heat up time the Russell Hobbs 20630 is both practical and efficient.
feature_bullets: The 45 g/min continuous steam will make light work of most fabrics, however the powerful 210 g steam shot is there to help you tackle stubborn creases with ease
3100 W of high-powered performance gives this power steam ultra a speedy heat-up time and it's 15% faster than previous Russell Hobbs models
Prolonging its life and maintaining performance a self-cleaning function will ensure your iron is free from impurities, such as scale
Improved glide means no more struggling to work your way through large laundry piles; 50% smoother than previous models with less of the effort
Activating if left on or knocked over the automatic switch-off function is perfect for busy households and those constantly rushing out the door

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars4,471 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
